title: Turoa Ski Field, Mt Ruapehu: Skiing vs snowboarding
text:
Turoa Ski Field, Mt Ruapehu: Skiing vs snowboarding Last updated 12:11, October 14 2015 ASHTEN MACDONALD/Stuff.co.nz 
We asked people at Turoa Ski Field, which is better: skiing or snowboarding? 
In the world of two options, tea or coffee, film or book, scrunch or fold the slope is no different. Are you a skier or snowboarder? 
At Turoa ski field this was an easy question; never has deliberation been so absent. 
The pros for snowboarding which appeals to the younger demographic included having less equipment, more control and the over look was "cooler". ASHTEN MACDONALD/FAIRFAXNZ 
Mt Ruapehu's Turoa ski field has extended their season to Labour Weekend following a late snow dump. 
Skiers say they are more fluid and argue they have the speed and freestyle ability that snowboarders have minus the bruising falls. 
READ MORE: Turoa Ski Field, Mt Ruapehu: Same altitude, different class 
More interestingly is have you tried the other, and why do you stick with the one you do? 
While many have tried the "dark side", others were not even tempted to pick up the opposition's tools. And skiers swore a greater allegiance to two blades than snowboarders did to one. 
Mount Ruapehu's executive manger, Simon Dickson, says there's still an uneven tip. 
"The stats show us skiing is holding its own in terms of a greater percentage. There is a slight increase in the popularity of skiing and that's relating back to activity around technology. 
People can get as much coverage around the mountain on skis and you don't just need to have a snowboard to do tricks." 
The writer travelled courtesy of Mt Ruapehu. 
Are you a skier or snowboarder? Let us know in the comments. - Stuff.co.nz
